sentences.sContent: Within hours of the news, Helen arrived to comfort her heartbroken friend.
sentences.sCn: 得到消息几小时以后，海伦赶来安慰她那心碎的朋友。

sentences.sContent: He longed to take her in his arms and comfort her.
sentences.sCn: 他很想把她搂在怀里安慰她。

sentences.sContent: Mr Aston’s father was last night being comforted by relatives.
sentences.sCn: 昨晚亲戚们都在安慰阿斯顿先生的父亲。

words.tran: 不舒服的；无安慰的；不自由的
安慰者；圣灵；（美）被子；（英）羊毛围巾

trans.tranOther: to make someone feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them or touching them
if someone or something gives you comfort, they make you feel calmer, happier, or more hopeful after you have been worried or unhappy
